Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kimdub155
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and had a good experience finding many choices to eat close by and we enjoyed the pool as well. The rooms are clean, simple and small but nice. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen b
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very accommodating and cheerful. Room clean and pool sparkling. No fridge or microwave. No big deal. Plenty of ice available. Great location on the strip and close to everything. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mmkcspd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to branson in a long time. We got into town early and they already had our room ready even though we were 4 hours early. The room was clean and for the price you can't beat it. It's right on the strip next to a lot of the major attractions. The parking was ok it is hilly bit your in the ozarks so you can't complain. Overall I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Paula L
Reviews.Content: After a horrible experience at another hotel, I was scrambling to find a place for my son and his family to stay that would accept their dog. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and they allowed for an early check-in. The room was nice and very clean. My daughter-in-law felt the place worked well for them, their baby and their dog.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Susan F
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times before, but we were there less than an hour and left to find a new hotel. The carpet was filthy. The kids kicked off their shoes as soon as we got there and within 15 minutes there feet looked like the had walked on tar. We spoke the the front desk and they were not concerned so we left. Was told no refund since they probably wouldn't be able to rent the rooms out that night. They were actually going to rerent the room even after we complained. Will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, fairly cheap, but needed some better upkeep around pool area”
Reviews.Author: AmbleOutdoors
Reviews.Content: Nice front desk staff, very basic room, ample indoor pool house that needed some better housekeeping given the heavy weekend tourist family traffic - kids galore. Plenty of flat parking. Nice grassy knoll view from hot tub zone was a welcome sight break from local cement. Easy north-west central location in greater Branson to use and access from multiple directions, aways from the main Highway 76 show strip and that saves some headache time when driving to make local fun spots. Branson has a dedicated color-coded tourist road system, and anyone is advised to learn it before visiting, to avoid show area traffic jams which are notorious. Did not use the paid breakfast, just the less appealing free side (get your tickets when you check in) which was pretty much biscuits and gravy fare plus drinks - they tried to upsell, we declined. There are higher end hotel and resort choices in Branson, but this was about our speed for a short family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaandDanny
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed 3 nights. The breakfast was delicious and the ladies there were so friendly and helpful, especially Marsha. She gives the most wonderful advice as to where to shop and eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is also in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dragon_CTW
Reviews.Content: the room and pools were great. but nothing special or exciting. just an average hotel to me. my son loved the pools. the breakfast is good. scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy and cereal. the basics. but it is tasty. the only thing we noticed was that almost every guest (including the kids) were Obese. even at the pool. kinda sad but i guess that's becoming the norm for America. maybe it was just the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let New Check In Building Deceive You, The Hotel Sectuin is OLD”
Reviews.Author: spdblondie
Reviews.Content: We did a total last minute trip for one night to Branson. We saw a nice reservation building and decided to price them. Got a quote of $67 (AAA discount applied) for a king room. Wi-fi, free hot breakfast, hot tub in indoor pool area. Outdoor pool not open yet (but it is only May 5th). Somehow it appeared from the placing of the check in building that the rooms were in the nice building adjacent. Then we learned, behind the check in area was the super old dingy group of buildings. The room was just ok. No headboard, old style tv and the A/C was not turned on so the room was musty and damp. It did quickly cool down though. The bathtub was old, the shower head was humorous. I am a 5'8 female and shower head was so low I had to practically do 1/2 a back bend to get my hair and upper body washed. The handle in the one piece tub enclosure fell out, while I was using it to steady myself to shave my legs. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows (look at the photos on here and you will see them) are like 1/2 the size of a normal bed pillow. I had to ask for more. The 'maid" who brought them to me is the same woman I saw running around in circles in a lower lot with in a golf cart. She knocked on the door, while smoking a cigarette, and handed me the pillows while her son was with her, and a dog was on a leash. The towels smelled of cigarette smoke. We later saw the same maid running around with a man and her son racing through the lower lot playing with the golf cart. Seemed rather odd. While walking up to the breakfast area, we noticed all the employees standing in and around the doorway to their laundry room. All of them were smoking, which is probably another reason why the towels and pillows smelled like they do. The indoor pool is very small. The hot tub is only suppose to serve 3-4 people, but everyone literally crams in. If this place was booked to capacity, it would be no fun at all, as there simply isn't enough room. The hotel didn't have many people there now, and it was already too crowded in the pool area. Admittedly, all the ladies working the breakfast area were cheerful, helpful and very friendly. Breakfast was the best part of the stay. We had scrambled eggs with ham and cheese, pancakes, donuts, etc. The food was hot and fresh. The gentleman at the front desk were all friendly and dressed very well. First impressions were awesome, but then you drive around to the rear of the property and are shocked! Pluses, front desk appearance and reservation agents were nice. Bed was comfortable, breakfast was very good. Free wi-fi worked well too. It was a short walk to a great late night "just dessert" establishment right across the street. Next time, I will pass this place by. There are too many other places to choose from to sleep in a place that smells of cigarette smoke and not so old, dark and dank, along with the musty feeling. Just my two cents.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best family value in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Rick F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of motels. Everything from, sleep with a gun, to Hiltons. Motel managers can't always control the building they have been given to manage but they can control their attitude towards that property. When I went to the desk I was greeted by three of the friendliest young people I have met in a long time. They cheerfully allowed me to look at a room. It hadn't seen an update for awhile but it was clean. The beds were extra comfy and the TV had a lot of channels to choose from. What more do you want because your plans in Branson are to see things, not stay in your room. Then things got good. We were there during the week and had the pool pretty much to ourselves in the afternoon. For a dollar we could use a dryer so we didn't have to pack our wet swimsuits. Breakfast was included in the price and included biscuits and gravy, cereal, fruit, etc. For a very small price you could get a cooked to order menu. It's centrally located and quiet while we were there, but then again it wasn't busy season. Every person on staff that we met, from the housekeepers to the maintainance, to the front desk always spoke to us and it was heart felt. Not simply a cordial hello. If I was still in management, this would be a place I'd go to recruit for employees. Keep up the great attitude and when the day comes that you get a new building or update you'll be the best place in Branson to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: Carla W
Reviews.Content: The pool and hot tub are small and the hot tub is more like a warm bath with strangers. The pictures must have been taken a long time ago because they do not represent the hotel as it is now. We thought we had the wrong place at first because it looked so different. The showers are small too, I'm short but still had to stoop to get under the water. Uncomfy beds and thin walls. Spend a bit more and go somewhere nicer, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't plan to stay here....”
Reviews.Author: vanillac2u
Reviews.Content: I had booked my room at the Howard Johnson, back in September....however, after my 8 hour drive to the hotel, we get there and there is a sign stating they were closed and I had to stay at the Quality Inn. SIGH! SO, we drive over to this hotel we knew nothing of. Get there, get inside and the rude woman at the front desk had no explanation of why NO ONE called me to tell me that my hotel had closed and that we had been moved. They didn't even have my name and reservation in the computer!! GRRR!!! The parking there is awful. We were in the first building that has a whole maybe 5 parking spaces...so we had to park clear down in the other lot and lug our luggage to the room. We finally get to the room, which has outdated decor and the WORST shower I have been in....the water wouldn't stay warm and cobwebs were all in the shower. Sigh.... I will say that the beds and pillows were super comfortable though. They do have breakfast in the AM- we had pancakes, donuts, eggs, biscuits/gravy, yogurt. The breakfast was okay- Howard Johnsons was much better...but oh yeah, I couldn't stay there.....

Reviews.Title: “Good motel”
Reviews.Author: jaboodi
Reviews.Content: Very clean and accomodating. Tv was old and tube type that had to warm up but we don't stay in the room when we are in Branson so it didn't matter much. We had heating units that were a bit difficult to regulate. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Take the good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: lm_jt_09
Reviews.Content: Was fairly expensive for the type of hotel it is. Holiday rates seemed double what it is worth. Bed was nice but bathroom was old, dingy and we had to step up into the room. We had a non-smoking room but had to walk past other guests who were smoking outside their rooms. We ended up walking through a wall of smoke in order to get to our room. No other entrance or we would have done that. Window coverings don't quite do the trick and we had bright lights in our room 24/7, along with a light under the bathroom step that was on the whole time. We ended up with a room that had a jetted tub next to the bed. The jets were very weak and it was basically just a large bathtub. Some guests had dogs and we could hear them barking early in the morning. Not the way I want to wake up when on holiday. The breakfast is really good, however, I was unhappy that one of the staff continued to whistle the whole time. Some may like whistling, but I wear hearing aids and found if very annoying. We dealt with this each day we ate there. On the plus side, the location is great and you can walk to many of the popular places even in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggrandma001
Reviews.Content: I made reservations a month ahead of time and the desk clerk had me totally sold on this motel. When I arrived, the desk clerk was more interested in getting the Christmas tree up then helping me. I was promised a downstairs room near the indoor heated pool. We were given a 3rd floor room in the second building (there are 3 buildings). When I asked what happened to my 1st floor room near the pool, I was told that was all that was available. I have a fear of heights and when I got off the elevator, I thought I was going to have to crawl to the room. It's high and looking out on hills and my stomache was flipping. Mad doesn't even begin to describe myself! On top of that, you could hear the people above us tromp all night. The room was ok. Overall clean, but some mold in the bathroom. The bed was ok but nothing special. The swimming pool was in the building across the parking lot. It was too cold to run across the parking lot to get there let alone run back to your room wet in 50 degree weather, so we didn't even get to use it. They did have a really good breakfast with eggs, biscuits n'gravy, cereals, pastries, juices, milk, coffee, etc. Although this motel is in a good area with-in walking distance from gift shops, shows and restaurants, I was disappointed with the accomodations and don't plan on staying there next year.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: kansas046
Reviews.Content: This was a great fairly inexpensive place to stay and located in the heart of Branson fun. The breakfast was great and the staff very friendly. I wil stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but outside areas not so hot”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Branson Quality Inn as part of a Silver Dollar City package deal. The rates were good, and we were specifically looking for indoor pool and free breakfast. We have 2 teenagers. The rooms were pretty nice with nice bedding and new-looking clean carpet. Shower head broke on us, but was fixed immediately! Breakfast was fine, although typical midwestern heart-attack fare. Very little protein and almost everything was processed and full of sugar/carbs, but that's pretty typical at this kind of hotel. I guess it's what people want. The lobby also looked recently decorated and was nice. The pool was warm and decent, but wow, what a lot of chlorine. Our eyes burned just sitting near it for 30 minutes and my daughter's hair is bleached after 3 swims! There was a laundry area that looked decent and the elevator worked well. My only real complaint is the concrete outside hallways and stairwells were gross. It seems they have spent money to upgrade, but need to spend money on a power-washer for the stairs & halls. Also, there was broken furniture sort of shoved in corners under stairwells - looked kind of trashy. So as we were entering for the first time we were really unimpressed, but then it turned out to be okay in the rooms & lobby. Not a bad place to stay, but could use a little sprucing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MizzouAlum09
Reviews.Content: For a fairly inexpensive hotel it was a great place! The room/bathrooms were clean, it was quiet and the location was fantastic! Definitely staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast buffet!”
Reviews.Author: a_butterfield
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this location twice in the month of June and loved it both times. Being right there on the main drag in Branson was perfect as we could get around fairly easily with little worry of getting lost. Lots of activity for all ages there. The hotel itself was well equipped with things like indoor/outdoor pools but could use a facelift. Very clean though. The buffet was awesome, that is where they won my heart! Something there for everyone and a great free way to start a vacation day. I'd stay there again, and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER recommend this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica R
Reviews.Content: They said it was recently updated, but our room was dingy and smelled. The comforters looked like they hadn't been washed and the towels and bathroom had hair in them. When we called for a new room it took the 20mins to finally move us right next door and acted like we were putting THEM out. That room smelled better and the comforters looked cleaner. The indoor pool had rust running down the windows and their hottub is a joke. It's a hottub you would place in your backyard and looked like it was about to fall apart. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Wary_Traveler_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn on the Branson Strip for one night. This is our second time at this property. The check-in staff was helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. The free in-room internet access was great! The morning breakfast was good. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Motel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: colin92
Reviews.Content: The official name is Quality Inn on the Strip and it was pretty centrally located to many activities. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Everything was immaculate with an outstanding free breakfast with waitress. Two swimming pools - one shaped like a guitar. Tickets for the shows were obtainable at the hotel at discounted prices. Excellent hotel for the money! Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “About the swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: torontojudy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine -- kind of average in terms of cleanliness, breakfast, room amenities, parking. But, the complaint I have is that the swimming pool did not have steps to get in and out. Now, I know this may not be a problem for younger people, but at my age, it became a crisis. Yes, I went down the ladder to go in, stayed in the pool and enjoyed myself. But, when it was time to get out, I could not get UP that ladder! Fortunately, there was a strong man and his girlfriend -- one pushed me from the back while the other pulled me from the front. Success! I got out, but it sure was embarrassing. So, I'm saying if you are older, be careful about this swimming pool. Oh yes, and as I always note about Choice Hotels -- their pillows are terrible -- very flat, very small, like half size. They are uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: pharmcat56
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of different times when visiting Branson and find the location to be convenient except for post show traffic jams that plague the strip each night. There is both an indoor and outdoor pool. They serve a hot breakfast with biscuits, gravy, and sausage in addition to the traditional continental fare. There are restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance. The rooms have no fridge which is disappointing but the ice machines in our building worked well. It's a good value for the price and is clean and well kept. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCKED OUT OF ROOM FOR OVER AN HOUR at 11PM!”
Reviews.Author: cruiseplanner02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in a jacuzzi room reservations thru Silver Dollar City website. We usually stay at the Grand Plaza so not what I expected being owned by same. Do not accept the rooms on the back side, "down the mountain" from where you check in. You basically have to drive to the breakfast each morning. The hill is straight up! On the 2nd night we were locked out of our room (11:00 p.m. at night for about an hour). Was told that this happens...called maintenance.. did not come... Finally, contacted the manager & he came and let us into our room with some device and said we could not leave without being locked out again and took our keys. The next morning, called desk (acted like they were not aware of our problem) we have to pack and change rooms which we are lucky that they had one with being the first weekend of Christmas shows. We were put on the top front side of hotel this time and the rooms were completely different. SO much nicer. Lost valuable vacation time.We almost checked out but our time was short so we did not want to take a lot of time changing. Breakfast was pretty good probably the best thing. Desk employees could have worked on hospitality and helpfullness during a trying time. Not even sure they apologized. There was another elderly lady with problems in there also when we was waiting. Talked down to her. Other staff encountered were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the 70's decor...”
Reviews.Author: kmjturtle
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is its breakfast, which even then isn't saying much. The rooms were okay if you want to travel back in time. The orange bed spreads and multi-colored brown and orange carpet can take you back fast. The rooms appear to have had an attempt at updating with fresh light green paint and modern paintings hanging on the walls; however, the cracks in the walls, splotchy-yellow shower, and bed spread must have not made the update list. I will say that the bed sheets and pillows were new and the room was kept pretty clean. Some other cons: The ice machines are old and spit out ice about 1 cube per 5 minutes. We tried them in both parts of the hotel at different times and they were both slow. The parking lots are all on inclines. This was fine for us, but anyone traveling with elders or the disabled might have issues here. Also, these rooms must have been smoking at one time because there is a smokey/musty smell. Some rooms are worse than others. We had 4 rooms and only one was too bad to stay in.. the other rooms still had the smokey odor but were bearable. Some pros: The use of either the outdoor guitar shaped pool or the indoor lap pool was quite nice. They were kept in great condition. I also liked the breakfast. There was a choice of egg, biscuits, gravy, pancakes, bagels, do-nuts, pastries, or cereal. Since we had kids with us this was good so the kids had a variety to choose from. The location is also pretty good.. it is in walking distance to several restaurants and several shows. It is right on the strip so I was able to walk out my door and run on the strip every morning. Overall, this place isn't thaaaat bad, but if you are like me and used to staying at places that are a bit nicer, then this place will disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “IF you are 41/2 ft tall, smoke, and enjoy parking on an incline,: This is a great motel.”
Reviews.Author: s_denise39
Reviews.Content: The picture doesn't do it justice. The picture shows a newly remodeled motel with a semi level parking lot. Reality is that the front part of the motel is remodeled only. There is another section to this motel that you get to down a steep incline that is common around Branson. This other part of the motel, maybe remodeled but not very well. The room is musty and has a smoky residue and smell. The bathroom is Small. The door sticks. The shower is great for people who are 4 ½ ft tall or shorter. The beds were uncomfortable. The hot tub doesn't look the same as it does in the picture it also didn't have a lot of water in it. The indoor pool is inside the other section of the hotel. The breakfast was great until one of the servers burped really loud. Didn’t cover mouth and didn’t wash hands. The staff was nice until you checked out. No thanks for staying , no asking for repeat business. I won’t recommend or stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.. bad parking lot”
Reviews.Author: ShhhQ
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our trip and we (my Mother and myself) both agree we won't be going back to Branson. We had a good time and if we returned would stay at the Quality Inn again... the rooms were comfortable, the breakfast was ok (not specatular, and stayed the same all week), and the staff was super friendly and helpful. What really was bad was the parking situation, the entire hotel is built on a hillside (as is almost alll of Branson) 90% of the lot is slanted to the point that I was too scared to park. I am not used to parking on slants and was afraid my car wouldn't be where I left it when I returned should my parking brake fail. The front (and most coveted) spots were only slightly slanted and I was comfortable with them, however there were only 8-10 of them. We were in the front of the front building, but when we came back to our room most nights the parking spaces close to our room (and the only ones I felt comfortable parking in) were taken. One night I ended up parking in front of the building behind us and another night I had to park at the very back.... the farthest away from my room as possible!!! I may recommend this to a friend... but with a warning.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Terboa
Reviews.Content: If you have young children, want to use the pool and cannot walk up stairs request a room up front.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great hotel is NOT”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreamGirl
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was friendly they gave us plenty of towels and other toiletries upon our request with no problem. The guest relations gentle man was very nice and helpful , he made sure to give us a list and map of all the Fourth of July activities. The breakfast cafe cooks were a delight, I enjoyed talking to them every morning. The all you can eat breakfast food was nice. They had a variety of comfort and healthy breakfast foods. I LOVED the location, right on the strip were most of our destinations are located. Unfortunately the rooms were not up to par. There were cob webs in the corner, and a bug on the sealing by the door. The air conditioner was not cool on it's highest setting, the remote to the television did not work I even brought batteries for it. The toilet seat was broken. The water pressure in the shower was very low. Bottom line, the room needs to be renovated and to top it off the maid only cleaned our room once and we were there for FOUR days!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bblondie
Reviews.Content: We stay at this motel twice a year. Love it from management to kitchen staff to housekeeping. Very clean, very comfortable beds, plus the entire staff was very accomodating! I can not say enough god things about this place. (I'm wondering where some of these disgruntled reviews are coming from, the competetion?) Awesome all the way around including the value!

Reviews.Title: “A great bargin”
Reviews.Author: wildadventurer
Reviews.Content: located on hwy 76 newly refurbished rooms price very reasonable included a full hot breakfast Outlet shopping in Branson a disappointment many stores closed.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about it will be back next year”
Reviews.Author: llildago
Reviews.Content: stood there the week of december 13th through the 19th 2008 did not want to leave, the hotel and all the staff members went above and beyond my expections. myself my wife , my mom and sister and boyfriend were taking in like family we celebrated a christmas party wth them as well as our 25th wedding anniversary and a birthday party with ms. mary ann who we will never forget.. the breakfast in the mornings was great everything was fresh and cooked to order by two great people ms mary ann and mrs. marsha and cannot forget ms annette who works the front desk and does a wonderful job at it. the week we were up there the weather was'nt so great but we made the best of it and still had a chance to do everthing we wanted to do. so on be-half of myself and my family we want to thank the general manager mr Kirt and all the wonderful staff you have working we with you. see you next year David Palermo from new orleans la.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: fultongal
Reviews.Content: I used my choice points for 2 nights here. I had a remodeled king room in the back building. It was very nice, a comfortable bed and quiet surroundings. The indoor pool is in this building, I didn't use it but it was clean and repainted. The property is on a downhill so staying in the back building can make walking to breakfast or to the strip an effort. If this is a problem, request the front part of the first building. The breakfast was very plentiful and good. Eggs, biscuits & gravy, pancakes, french toast, cereals, breads, juice, milk. Everyone should be able to find something to eat. The ladies cooking were very nice as were the people at the front desk. The picture on the website is a little deceiving, it's not a sprawling resort but it is sufficient. Since it's located on the strip getting around by car could take a while but there's lots of things to do within walking distance. I would stay again but $60.-$70. would be tops.

Reviews.Title: “decieving!”
Reviews.Author: kimmie375
Reviews.Content: I was about 30min out side of Branson when I call choice hotels directly.I only called sice I decided it looked good online and didnt want to shop around.They assured me it was 3+ star and had all amentites in above par condition.Not so.Thr dront of the building and outside pool was very nice and deep like 10ft,we had alot of fun racing to the bottom.Our room was average at best,the indoor pool facility was horrible! Filled with mildew,smelled aweful,the walk way was slimy and the ceiling was falling down and the hot tub was on a platform as if it was on a patio. Breakfast in the morning was a joke! There were busses full and not where to eat we had to stack plates,assign drink carriers ect and eat in our room. I did talk to the office starting 30min after check in til check out about the issues no refund,no discount,no apology.We will never stay again.It was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “pictures deceiving”
Reviews.Author: chryspys
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through ReserveDirect, which includes City Hopper passes to Silver Dollar City and Celebration City. The pictures on the ReserveDirect website are a bit misleading. The front part of the hotel is either newer or it has been remodeled. The back part is much older. Although I booked this trip a few months ago, we were put on the very back part of the property. These rooms aren't as nice. I requested a non-smoking room, and it was obvious the room that were we given had been a smoking room at some point. I am not a smoker, never have been a smoker, and I don't want to smell like smoke. The rooms were very clean, however. We used the indoor pool...ONCE. There was mold growing on the walls, and the ceiling was in the beginning stages of falling apart. I will say that the free hot breakfast was very good. We did not have to get breakfast "passes" or hear a timeshare speech. Would we stay here again? No. I would spend extra money, and stay at the hotel that we stayed at last year. Hindsite is indeed 20/20.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuddy25
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 6 nights here and they were great.The staff here is unbeatable.Everyone was very friendly from check in to check out and got us whatever we needed.The rooms are a little small ,you had to hide behind the toilet to shut the bathroom door,but were very clean and the beds were comfy.The service here made up for the tiny rooms.The free breakfast was great ,not just donuts and coffee like other places but a full breakfast.The serving staff was a hoot, it was like a comedy show every morning really great.The pools were nice too they had an indoor and an outdoor pool .It made it nice we could swim when it rained one day.They also had discount show tickets and gave us some great advice on which shows to see!! I will stay here every time I visit Branson,which is at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping and the view was the best part”
Reviews.Author: redneckmama67
Reviews.Content: The best thing about our stay was the view from our second floor room. It faced away from the strip the view was great. On our second day the housekeeping lady was very friendly and helpfull as our child was sick during the night. The breakfast was so crowded the line was 25-30 people long. We thought going a little later the next day would be better, the line was even longer. The outdoor pool was great, but the reviews about the indoor pool were right on. The ceiling tiles were missing, some barely hanging and the wall was molding. It was nice the pools had towels. Our air-conditioner was new that was good. No micro-fridge I guess you had to pay extra for that. Other than that it was your average motel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST of service”
Reviews.Author: bill-ho
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the "Choice Hotel" booking site. The motel is currently undergoing some renovation and we were initially placed in a room near the work and some items in our room were being reworked. Upon request, they readily changed our room to a larger and better equipped one. The room was clean, large and quiet. The most notable quality of the motel is the courtesy and help fullness of the staff -- they readily answer all question and offered good suggestion regarding local shows and restaurants and helped with arrangements and schedules. The breakfast buffet was also quite good and all of this at a very reasonable rate of under $60.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended, especially if you have small children”
Reviews.Author: bh13
Reviews.Content: We booked a package at Silver Dollar City that included stay at this hotel (the one on the strip, I believe there are two Quality Inns in Branson.) The lobby building is gorgeous, but the rest of the hotel is subpar. It definitely has that old-motor-lodge-renovated-on-the-ultra-cheap musty thing going on. The carpet in our room was absolutely filthy and laid tub-style (running up the walls, but not secured to the walls and frayed at the cuts/corners. There was lots of evidence of water damage in the bathroom. The sink did not drain (or did so slowly as to be unusable.) The shower drained slowly too, and the shower head is only about 5 feet from the tub floor, so bending over is necessary if you're not short. The caulking job in the bathroom/lavatory/sink areas is terrible (not really a functional problem, but definitely lends to the cheap/very-low-quality feeling of the place.) The air conditioner in our room worked, but had duct tape holding parts of it together, and the register was missing. The gap under the room door was huge, letting in whatever smells/light/noise happened by outside. The railing outside our door (on the 4th floor) had a broken weld, basically allowing an entire section of it to be pushed outward at the bottom (4 story drop to the parking lot, definitely not kid-safe.) Lots of other small details inside the room were evidence of of lack of competent maintenance/investment and just really made the place feel dirty/cheap. The bedding seemed clean (we never use the comforters in hotels so didn't check that) and didn't smell and the beds were relatively comfortable with the exception of the pillows, but I'm not picky about mattresses. The indoor pool area was mildewy/moldy. A lot of the suspended ceiling tiles above the pool are misplaced/missing and parts of the walls/ceilings were warped/sagging. The water was nice and warm, but way too much chlorine, our kids' eyes were disturbingly red/iritated within 15 minutes, so we had to get out. The free breakfast was OK, certainly more variety than you get at many hotels, but the quality of the prepared foods was low. The staff was pleasant, no problems there.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Christie22
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Branson,Missouri. We stayed at The Quality Inn on the 76 strip. For $62 we got a clean room and a full hot breakfast of pancakes, eggs, biscuits and gravy each morning. The breakfast dining area is the biggest I've seen in a hotel and very clean. The carpet in our room needed to be replaced and the tub could use a good scrubbing, but the beds were VERY comfortable. The lobby is beautiful....it would be nice if they would keep the hotel rooms that nice. Well worth staying there, if you are trying to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lona
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, we were able to walk to a few things so we avoided the traffic which was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great....”
Reviews.Author: katerina111
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at QI 76. It's not my type of motel, the rooms are very basic, not real clean, beds are hard, pillows flat, and it has that "musty, old motel room" smell. The air conditioning wasn't working but that was fixed quickly after I told them about it. Drains were slow, shower curtain was ridiculous, didn't fit, and water ran everywhere no matter how hard I tried to make it stay. We were not told about the pool indoors, but the pool outdoors seemed ok. I did see the maintenance man checking it often. The breakfast is served in a strange way....making everyone stand in line no matter how much or how little they want for breakfast. I would have only liked to pick up a bagel or something, but couldn't get near them because everyone stood in line and there were ropes confining the line. I think it would work much better if everyone could just go up and take what they needed like they do in most hotels. The food wasn't that great, so we ate elsewhere the whole trip after wasting time standing in line the first day. I would not stay here again. There are better places to stay and wish I had read all the reviews before I made my reservations. I am not a real picky person, but some things just need to be a certain way.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: niece90
Reviews.Content: The room was too small. If it had been just my husband and I, it may have been okay. It had a musty smell. The bathroom left hardly any room to turnaround in. The pool (which the kids were excited about) was at the opposite end of our room. It was a little walk to get there. They did not get to swim. We stayed only one night of the 3 we had booked. The husband and kids said the breakfast was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: LadyLionMom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Branson 6/16 thru 6/20. We were disappointed with the breakfast as we were expecting more from the previous reviews. Our experience left us with tough pancakes (daughter could not cut them with a knife, nor tear them apart with the hands), the meat that was in the eggs was suppose to be ham??? If you liked doughnuts, muffins and such I suppose you would have been pleased. We were never asked for our breakfast coupons which we had to receive upon arrival through the ticket office. The offer for a free show was not without a catch. Catch---having to sit through a 90 minutes presentation of vacation properties. Not something we wanted to do on our vacation. Never once did they let up on this. The parking was also somewhat a hassel. We had a lower level room in the front building but had to park behind and down the hill from our room every night except one. Not sure that we would stay at this hotel again, considering the many options within Branson.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: BlueMist3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on Hwy. 76 in Branson, Mo. for 3 nights. They have an indoor pool in which the water wasn't real clean as well as the hot tub not very clean either. Otherwise the pool area was well kept. Our rooms were very nice. They were cleaned 2 days and got fresh linens and towels on those 2 days. On the 3rd day the room was not cleaned at all, trash not emptied, no clean towels or anything. We called the desk and complained and was told they would send some right away. We waited for about 2 1/2 hours none arrived. My husband had to go get them himself. Upon checkout time we asked for some kind of credit and was told they couldn't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: buddySpringfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time because we wanted to take our puppy dog with us. The room that we stayed in was a bit smaller than the room without pets, but it was very comfortable and did not smell of former pets. The beds were very comfortable, however, I prefer a bit larger pillow. The breakfast was very good and the server/cook was very accomodating. The selection was large and she would even personally make pancakes and French toast to order. I will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we visit the Branson area.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for what you spend”
Reviews.Author: arat18
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Quality Inn on 76. My husband is a Choice Priviliges member, and we are still using hotel points he earned while working out of state and living in a Sleep Inn. We've stayed in several Choice Hotels, including the Econo Lodge and the newest Comfort Inn in Branson. For the amount of points I used on this stay (half as many as the Comfort Inn of the previous stay), I would have to say I was very satisfied. The rooms are a bit outdated and in need of a little TLC, but they were clean. The breakfast was great - it was nice to have hot choices that didn't have to be put in a toaster. We found all of the employees to be friendly. We too had to go pick up our breakfast tickets (which we were never asked to show) and were asked if we would have the time to listen to something to save money on our stay, but I simply said no, and wasn't hounded any further. We stayed in the building closest to the lobby/breakfast room, but I didn't feel that the other building was too far of a walk. If you are looking for Hilton/Hyatt/Marriott type accomodations, this hotel isn't for you, but if you want a less expensive, clean place to stay in a pretty good location, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inn, HWY 76 GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: allysmom
Reviews.Content: After visiting Branson many many times we decided to stay on the strip, across from the Baldknobbers. This motel, even though they do not have inside corridors, was probably the best we've stayed in. The price was very reasonable, the FULL breakfast saved $$ each day, and the quietness was appreciated. You sure can't beat the location. I would highly recommend this motel to anyone! Clean, comfortable, quiet, and reasonably priced...great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: den&holly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn on 76 Hwy for only one night, July 4th. We traveled last minute and booked a room on reservebranson - double queen for 2 adults, $48.10. We had stayed at the Quality Inn on the Shepard of the Hills Expressway before and so we compared the 2. The QI on the strip needs some updating to the room furnishings, though they were clean and serviceable. It was nice to be right on the strip, and we watched the fireworks from the hotel. They have an indoor and an outdoor pool and there were families enjoying both. Breakfast was better than the usual Branson fare - it included scrambled eggs, pancakes, biscuits and gravy plus rolls, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee and even soda. We probably would stay here again if the price was right, we just think the Quality Inn on the Shepard of the Hills Expy is newer and also within walking to shopping, shows and restaurants - just different ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: wheatfarmer
Reviews.Content: This motel is right on the strip if you like to be right in the middle of the action. There are two buildings of rooms, and the parking lot is on a hill, but so is everything else in Branson! The indoor pool is in the end of one of the buildings, so if you get the other building you would have to walk outside to get to the indoor pool. There is an outdoor pool too that I presume is open in the summer. The breakfast is in a seperate building that you have to walk a little ways to, but it is good. The two best things about this motel are the value (the cheapest motel that I have stayed in in years!) and the service. The people were all so nice, the front desk people, breakfast staff, and even the maid was the nicest, politest maid I had ever seen. I would definately stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: buckeyegirl68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Branson two nights at the Quality Inn, based on a review we read. Our room was at the back with a long walk to the breakfast. I had booked a room 5 months ahead and felt I could have been given a more convenient room especially since most rooms appeared empty. The room was clean but very plain and old. The sink was stopped up which we reported but the desk clerk seemed uninterested. The breakfast was good. When we checked in we were told to go to another room to pick up our breakfast passes. Actually this was a way to get us to hear about the "plan to save on travel expenses" that they wanted us to attend. They really pushed this, offering free shows and money if we sat through two hours of a talk. We turned down the offer and were given our breakfast passes which we did not need and were never asked for at breakfast time. The location was good but we saw other motels right next door which looked newer and more attractive. We also noticed that there were other motels much cheaper than what we paid. I would not recomment this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient - A real value”
Reviews.Author: jennybean1975
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Branson and stayed at the Quality Inn on 76. Boy were we impressed! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and the place was so close to the several attractions! The rooms were large and spotless and the breakfast was better than I expected. I too am not a fan of powdered eggs, but with everything on the bar, we all left stuffed! :) Our rooms were taken good care of and we never ran out of towels before they brought a fresh supply. We took my father-in-law who is recovering from a stroke, and they placed us next to the elevator which was nice. We were so close to several theaters that we walked to a show and dinner every night we were there. Not being stuck in traffic after the shows let out made this hotel ideal for us. The nice lady in the ticket office of the hotel got us front row seats to Baldknobbers an hour before the show and saved us nearly $10 on the tickets to boot. I highly recommend this hotel and will be back to stay there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with room and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: OkieinMo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the two reviews that were posted here. The room we were given was very well used...the carpeting was almost bare and needed a good vacuum job (thick with dust in one corner and lots of ???? near the bed), the tile in the bathroom and lavatory area was cracked in several places and had some burn holes in it even though the room was a "no smoking" room. The toilet seat was loose also. I had explained that I didn't do well with stairs and asked if an elevator was available if we weren't given a street level room....we were put in the area that is the most removed from the motel office/breakfast room and we had to walk to full length of the motel to get to a ramp or use the stairs - I never saw an elevator. The walk to the breakfast area was very hilly and hard to traverse from our room. The breakfast featured powdered eggs (yuck) which I could not eat - the waffles were the pre-frozen variety (verses the "cook them fresh" kind that some motels feature)....the biscuits and sausage gravy were good (thankfully) as was the pancakes, but both mornings had very long lines waiting not only for food but also for a table once you had food. We would have moved to another place but I was recovering from an injured arm and our daughters had paid for the room for us in advance for our 40th anniversary and we didn't want to make them feel bad about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Inn on 76”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice, convenient place to stay. We were able to obtain tickets for attractions right there. Extended breakfast was wonderful and the breakfast room was attractive and clean. Would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn - Branson, MO
HotelInfo.Address: 2834 West SR 76, Branson, MO 65616
